intro: Eurycoma harmandiana var. harmandiana, commonly known as the Malayan dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy, oval-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, forested areas and thrives in tropical climates. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with similar characteristics. The species is noted for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in traditional remedies.
